caption: I’ve not tried their chocolate yet but their pastries are great. There is only a single person serving in the shop whenever I visited,so sometimes I had to wait a while till she came out from the kitchen.
Amazing chocolate and macarons, really amazing tastes of different types and shapes
Great hot chocolate
The best hot chocolate in Chicago!!! Also try the milk chocolate candy.

Europe's finest cafe, transported to Chicago. Fresh baked chocolate croissants, crepes of all kinds, cakes, espresso drinks, amazing hot chocolate, gelato, and of course, the world's best Belgium chocolate.
Best hot chocolate!!
Great cozy place. The coffee is A-, but the chocolate is A+. Friendly personnel. Highly recommended.
Their coffee is good, their chocolates are obviously great, Belgian of course! I had a croque monsieur, it was nice!
Got their triple chocolate hot chocolate. Sooo good! 10/10

My friend introduced me to this cafe. I’d walked past hundreds of times, without realizing they were more than just a chocolate shop. We stopped in this weekend for a bite and some hot drinks. I had a delicious spinach, sun-dried tomato & goat cheese quiche and warm apple cider to drink. I loved everything I had.  The service was excellent and I plan to be a regular.
(Translated by Google) Place to buy chocolate and also to sit for coffee in downtown Chicago  (Original) Lugar para comprar chocolate y también para sentarse a tomar un café en el centro de Chicago
Delicious

Small cozy clean cafe. Felt like I was in Europe as I drank my most delicious salted caramel hot chocolate. Literally like drinking melted chocolate, for some may be too sweet But I LOVED it. Lots of chocolates selection!
Amazing chocolates and sweets, and amazing service!

We were walking around downtown and spotted this shop, cute, warm and welcoming shop. While I was peering through the window at the menu I looked up and my son was already inside looking back at me. It was cold out and we wanted something hot. My son ordered the salted caramel hot chocolate, he said it was really good.  I ordered the Mexican hot chocolate which was great (Highly recommend if you like cinnamon). We also ordered brownies which we didnt eat until we were home, I ate my brownie warm and it was so GOOOOOD! Walking around in the cold stop by for some delish Belgium hot chocolate and great brownies.
Hmm my experience at Zaharakos & Ghirardelli is better.
Decadently wonderful. Magnifique!
The hot chocolate was too sweet i would appreciate having a dark chocolate in my hot chocolate. But we loved it specially in a freezing chicago weather

Fantastic little shop. I got the tiramisu gelato and a chocolate eclair. The gelato was perfectly creamy and textured with ladyfingers cookies. The serving portion was also very generous. The eclair was incredible, and had a chocolate filling which was a wonderful surprise. I would definitely recommend stopping by here. Really friendly staff too.
It was the best coconut macaroon I've had in a while, there were alt milk options for my hot chocolate - together was surprising $8. Sub par staff and service was what dampered my experince.
Terrible terrible service
Incredible service, and great chocolate!
Cute, authentic French crepes, Belgian waffles and chocolates.
Delicious 👌🏽

(Translated by Google) The paradise of Chocolate, the best are the Belgians, a lot of variety, you can assemble your box (different sizes) in bulk or choose the ones that are already armed, they offer a bar of drinks simply spectacular in flavor, it is not cheap, but it is the best They will find.  (Original) El paraíso del Chocolate, los mejores son los Belgas, mucha variedad, puedes armar tu caja (diferentes tamaños) a granel o escoger las que ya están armadas, ofrecen una barra de bebidas simplemente espectacular en sabor, no es barato, pero es lo mejor que encontrarán.

Private label teas, ice cream and gourmet chocolates. Mmmm!!  My wife LOVES the crepes. She tries a different one each time we go. The service is great. The store is kid-friendly, & gift boxes are available when purchasing for that special someone.  They even have a rewards program! (Recommended if you go often.)  Pro Tip: Ask for a real spoon when enjoying the ice cream.
Perfect place for chocolate lovers. But Coffe can be better, stuff should learn how to make real espresso drinks
Loved that the owners are Asterix fans
Crepes are delicious.
$$$$ chocolate was good. There are other locations that has better options and price.
Chocolate what else can i say
Good chocolates and shakes!
Great chocolate, plus you can help support the seahorses.

We were taken to this place in downtown Chicago by a local friend insisting on a good cup of coffee, as one would usually find in Belgium. Although the coffee was alright, the pastries did not live up to their cultural franchise. Unforgivable, we thought.
(Translated by Google) Very helpful staff  (Original) Πολύ εξυπηρετικοί υπάλληλοι
(Translated by Google) Chai latte  (Original) Chai latte

We had high hopes for this little cafe, as it was right around the corner from our hotel. However, the crepes we ordered were lacking in flavor. I had a brie, walnut and apple crepe which was lacking in brie. My wife had a strawberry crepe which was practically tasteless. Both were actually pretty tasteless. We will be trying somewhere different next time.
Best Hot chocolate in Chicago!
Nice place and good chocolate & coffee I ordered caramel late it wasn't very sweet I like that

I adored my pitstop over here! After a long walk outside in the windy Chicago cold, I went in to get warm over hot chocolate. I have been in the USA for 4 months and I miss our Belgian chocolate, no country can beat our taste. So I had to get it over here and Leonidas café did not disappoint. My hot chocolate was heaven and my perfect European pancake with hot chocolate sauce was delicious. It really was our Belgian chocolate! Totally worth the price!
Exceptional and decadent Extreme Dark Chocolate Hot Chocolate. Cute little shop with delicious looking crepes and treats. Definitely will be back next time we're in the neighborhood.
Delicious dark chocolate hot cocoa. I had to go back the next day
I highly recommend the triple hot chocolate. It's really😋... Kelsey & Shelby know how to make it very delicious 👍🏻
Their hot chocolate taste soo good. They're definitely a chocolate store

Only known for chocolates otherwise cupcakes are horrible (should not be available for purchase). I actually thought they had made a mistake with the ingredients and notified staff who did not seem to mind.

A French/Belgian themed chocolate store with a huge variety of different things to pick from such as hot chocolate to crepes to chocolate. They have a nice dining area in here too though it was on the more expensive side. A nice alternative to Starbucks in the middle of the city.

This is my favorite go to chocolate cafe in the city. The best hot chocolate in town. Drinking a cup of it makes me feel that I’m in love. Their chocolate and crepes are amazing as well. I had hot apple cider this time, it was yummy!
Lovely coffee and dark hot chocolate.
The hot chocolate here is stellar!

My sister bought me Leonidas chocolates before when she went to Europe. The chocolates were really good. When I knew Leonidas store opened in Chicago I was so excited to stop by. I went with my family one of the weekends. The place was hard to find. But, that’s okay... The problem was the store was very untidy, I would say not clean/messy for a store selling food/desserts. I was very disappointed coming in to this store.  Overall: Service: 3stars Food: 3stars Price:$-$$  Not recommended!!! ☹️

I used to love coming here for a cocoa and chocolate but these past few months have not been stellar.  For over four years I'd pop in and come here for cocoa and pleasing conversation but unfortunately this place is constantly hiring new people so my favorite staff members have long gone namely Mario who always had a kind word to say. Today I came in feeling pretty good and I was craving a hot chai and eclair so the guy in charge today told me the eclairs were available but not properly thawed out even though I got here at 6:39 PM. He was the only server here and the chai was excellent but my eclair was pretty frozen from the inside after I took a bite and the server took it from me realized I had taken a single bite and told me he could not place it in the oven now due to health regulations.  After 4 years of eating here not one person mentioned that they had a points program or loyalty program. I must have visited three or more times a month and no one mentioned the rewards to me till I inquired 7 months ago.  One server explained they are encouraged by the owner never to volunteer that information to customers so after 4 years of my loyalty and not knowing about loyalty points then being served a frozen eclair by a non apologetic and smug server I'll happily stop encouraging my clients to come here and I think I'll find another place to relax. If you take into consideration that these young servers also enjoy gossiping about customers behind behind their backs...like this one girl named Maeve whom I overheard while drinking my cocoa here then you're going to want to get chocolate to go not stay here. This place isn't friendly anymore nor is it welcoming and I was completely disrespected after being served as frozen eclair.  If the owner cares maybe she'll consider refunding me for the eclair tonight but tonight prompted me to write a review especially since a server this past summer complained to me that business here was slow. It's slow because they mistreat customers here and I definitely feel awkward now so I really don't feel compelled to return to this location downtown.   If you want to purchase chocolates as a gift this place is adequate but customer service here is lacking and unfriendly most of the time depending upon who works here on what day of the week. I'm a die hard chocoholic but the ambiance here is lacking if they can't be bothered to reheat a frozen eclair.
The best croissants in the city!
Best ever!
Belgian chocolates what else can I say
Best coffee in town served in a real cup and with a real terrace to enjoy Chicago outside
Great European style desserts and chocolates.   Seating is very limited.

What can one say, the chocolates are to die for!  A wide variety of chocolate bonbons can be combined in gift boxes of various sizes for that very special present that is both elegant and delicious. The shop has a few small tables inside and, weather oermitting, also street side tables.  The hot chocolate is, of course, divine and perfect for a warwarm-up on a freezing Chicago winter day. The shop also offers some baked goods. When we were there in the late afternoon the cakes had been sitting out for hours and were unfortunately dried out (hence only 4 stars), but were still delicious. I highly recommended this sweet shop as a perfect place of indulgence to every chocolate lover.

Coffee is really nice and barista (guy) very positive person. But ... They served me coffee with glued peace of porcelain like it was broken before. I ordered chocolate eclair but I never got it. Yep, maybe it's kind of misunderstanding because of my not very good English skills at listening, but why if I ordered latte and eclair not gonna get it? Also I hate aggressive pay marketing. Once u pay they turn display to you to make a choice how much tips u wanna left. I'd love to leave tips, but only by.my choice, not by force. So, I left with expensive 11 bucks latte. And nece ever gonna come back again.

Leonidas is a fantastic Belgian chocolate company. After research before my trip to Brussels in Belgium, I found the three best/main chocolatiers were Neuhaus, Leonidas, and Godiva. In my opinion, their quality were also in that order (all good however). To my delight, I found a location in Chicago, as they are not so common in the US. This particular location was nice, it had a small café where you can sit and enjoy the treats you just bought, which I haven't seen at all I'm Brussels or the Neuhaus I found in DC. This location also had gelato, and the workers were very friendly- offering to make a milkshake per my request even though it was off the menu. However, I changed my mind to the extreme dark hot chocolate (made with several scoops of their dark chocolate milk, some powder and milk) which was delightful, thick, and very rich, just how it should be.

This is a chocolate shop selling various kinds of chocolate, drink and small food. So it has something special compared to other cafes, but it is not special about taste, service and comfort. First, the taste is normal. There are various menus, but people choose limited. I do not recommend anything other than chocolate, especially. Next, the service is too common. Finally, the place is too narrow and the indoor is hot. Many people choose outdoor, but it is difficult to get services. In other words, it's a good place if you take your chocolate, but it's too bad to stay here.
Closed at 7.
Great coffee & crepes!
Much more expensive than the location in Brussels, but the authentic thing!
If you saw the movie "Chocolat" and dreamed about experiencing that kind of chocolate, this is the place to do it.

Cute chocolate shop right off Magnificent Mile. They have delicious hot chocolates. If you are wanting one that isn't too sweet yet packs that chocolate punch go with their Triple Chocolate. It has Dark, Milk and White Chocolate. Their good also looked great. Sweet little spot for a quick morning bite or even afternoon snack.
Lovely place. Crapes, omelets, croissants - delicious!

I was disappointed. It was mostly candies, mostly the kind you can find pretty much anywhere. Nothing really stood out as amazing. Granted, I was also there when they were in the middle of moving out Christmas decor and moving in Valentines stuff so the place was a disaster and probably not normally like that, but shouldn't you take that into consideration? It was 1pm on a Friday. Seems like they could've done some of that on a day when they were closed.
Food and chocolate beverages were great. But with one employee running the show. It took over an hour to receive breakfast.
Best chocolate in Chicago, friendly atmosphere and a myriad of clientele.

Leonidas Cafe was an incredible experience. It does great justice to the magical experience of walking into a chocolate shop. I ordered the three egg omelette with turkey, Brie and mushrooms, which was excellent. It's a good idea to balance the sweet dishes with a savory dish if you come!!
It's such a cute little place for chocolate and coffee. In a way, it reminded me of a tiny French cafe and sure enough, I sat next to a French guy! Ha!
Delightful crepes and coffee, with a large variety of delicious chocolates. Very friendly and helpful staff. One of my favorite spots to relax after work :)

Wonderful place.. no one wants to share their Favorite find... but this place is worth letting ppl know about.. small coffee place vibe with a character and music that stands out... has chocolate which is always a +.. but most importantly adding to all the menu items it has the best crepes in the city mile radius i had so far and the crafted recipes are not bland a d devoted to nutella and banana only.. for me this is a major MAJOR thing... the crepe mix used to make them is just right and i tried nutella and the Eatally crepes and this is superior in and doesnt have an industrial consumer feel to it.. tastes superior... and ofcourse customer service is really pleasant.... PS. Great coffee.... Btw i don't like writing reviews ... 👌👍
Slow service, the place was packed after lunch time. The chocolate is excellent, worth waiting for.

Great little place for desserts and drinks, Jo was super friendly and helpful! The drinks are super good and what coffee should be, no doubt super fresh. Not much seating, but a quiet little place to enjoy your coffee!

I'd give it zero. There's this little white boy that was rude to my friends for no apparent reason. Probably bored. Not worth coming in at all. So many better places in the city of Chicago! Where people aren't rude. Everything seems out dated too, and its expensive.
Amazing.

Probably my favorite local coffee shop, their drinks are accurate to what they should be (IE the difference between a Starbucks latte and cappuccino is negligible but here it is happily different.) The seating is small but always has been adequate for two to four people. More is possible but not always. They have quite a chocolate selection, gelato, crepes and pastries in addition to their great coffee selections. This is definitely a cafe people should try.
Very good chocolate items here.
Excellent coffee, sweets, and service.
Great service, and the treats are amazing!
Good stuff...too many yuppies though
Very good Belgian chocolates. A bit pricey.
Very nice staff. nice variety of chocolates & treats.

Nice drinks and chocolates. Ambiance is also pleasant. During summer there's outdoor seating although traffic and noise on Chicago Ave makes it uninteresting. My only complaint about the place are the prices. A bit too high. It's river north though so you're kind of stuck with it.
Great chocolate place, but actually also a little secret for lunch (savoury crepes, quiches). My favourite though is the dark hot chocolate with two shots of espresso no cream!!
Great service and tasty sweets. Coffee was far superior to Starbucks.
Great hot chocolate, but the medium size is pretty large. A little on the pricy side.
Excellent coffee and the  sweet unbelievable
Really good coffee and service!
Nice varieties

This place has good (albeit expensive) chocolate truffles to eat. My fiancé and I often stop in when we're downtown for some delicious hot chocolate. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is small and fairly expensive.

What a wonderful little store!  Delicious treats....too many to choose from.  :-)  We worked with Jo who was so patient and explained things so well.  She helped us throughout our time there from the chocolates all the way through the ice creams and sorbets.  Loved how we could pick and choose what we wanted so easily and yet it was very reasonably priced.  Great service!  Will go again!
(Translated by Google) Best Coffee in Chicago!  (Original) Найкраща кава у Чикаго!
Awesome Belgian cafe.  We tried the chocolate crepe and a couple of the croissant sandwiches, all were outstanding.
I was here for the first time and tried Salted Caramel hot chocolate. It was so delicious and perfect for this cold Chicago weather!
Friendly staff, nice chocolate.
First time. Refered from a friend. Coming back soon many times. I tried the chocolote ice cream, eclairs, and mille feuille(best ever). They are all great, rich in flavor. I love this place

Love it. The triple hot chocolate was really soothing after a long walk shopping back and forth through Michigan. Their other menu like chocolate and cakes were also tempting & delicious. Small place but nice & warm interior. Sure I will visit this place again and recommended.

I've loved Leonidas chocolates for a couple decades now and I was so ecstatic to find out that a shop opened in Chicago!  Every time we would visit London, we'd take a dozen boxes of Leonidas home with us.  Or if someone was visiting from London, we'd ask them to bring a few boxes with them.  The chocolates from here are exquisite!  My favorite kind has always been the Manon Cafe, which is white chocolate with a coffee buttercream inside topped with a hazelnut.  I also like the Gianduja, which is rich almond/hazelnut praline covered in gold wrapping.   I opted to get only a few items when I visited yesterday since I was pretty much chocolated-out from a chocolate tour that we just completed.  However, there's no doubt I'll return for more!  Leonidas also offers marzipan, macaroons, and gelato in addition to their chocolates.  I'll probably try these too sometime in the near future.

Amazing Gelato, delicious deserts cakes, rich hot chocolate,  great coffees and lattes. Quiet and classy atmosphere. Patio and indoor seating. Good service. Definitely a unique coffee/chocolate shop. Highly recommend.
